pr_title: Recover from account balance files with different timestamps

timeline.message:
Recover from account balance files with different timestamps

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText: nit: the log warning doesn't say why you are ignoring. You should add a reason for easy troubleshooting
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: It does, doesn't it? It says it's associated with the previous close interval. You want me to tweak it to say "the previously processed stream file"?
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: On 2nd read it does. Didn't jump out at me so yeah I'd say "previously processed stream file" is more clear.
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: I think you should pull this section into its own method with some comments on the method for clarity.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText:
method name seems to be general and therefore not concerned  with file type (balance/record/event), but removeEnd() applied to only Balances.
You should either rename the function to highlight Balance or make it work for all 3 types for shared use.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: The method is named general and does work for all 3 types, as its test shows. True, it's a bit of a hack to do something specific to balance but it saves me from either having 3 different methods or passing in streamtype. Balance file is the only file with an extra suffix of _Balance after the date and before the extension. What do you suggest?
replies.author: steven-sheehy
Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Having a concrete method named getTimestampFromBalanceFile means I can no longer use it from the generic Downloader
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: nit: quite the involved setup on files. A few comments might make it easier to read and therefore easier to maintain
